## Reason of admission
69 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-08 with a swollen right leg since three days. Patient noticed progress of swelling and appearance of redness and diffucluty walking on day 3.

## Medical history
Hypertension, chronic kidney disease stage 3

## Hospital course
On examination swollen right leg with defined redness and pain when palpated. Patient received Bensylpenicillin 1 gram x 3 intravenously for suspected erysipelas. To exclude the presence of deep vein thrombosis in the right leg the patient underwent an ultrasound examination which did not reveal any signs of DVT. Patient recieved oxynorm and was able to mobilise the leg. No pain. Ward nurse informed patients wife and planned for transporatation home on 2024-01-11. Bensylpenicillin intravenously changed to fenoximetylpenicillin 1gx3 until 19/1.
